sentences.english: The city site has city wall and moat surround with two ditches.
sentences.chinese: 该城址拥有城墙和护城河，另有内外双重围壕。

sentences.english: Dashigu Wall City of Erlitou Culture was discovered in Zhengzhou of the east.
sentences.chinese: 东边的郑州还出现了大师姑二里头文化城址。

sentences.english: The castle of zhangjiakou, set up in 1429, is properly located.
sentences.chinese: 1429年兴建的张家口堡城址选择得当。

sentences.english: The city fo Tangshan was rebuilt on the site of the old city.
sentences.chinese: 唐山市是在旧城城址上重建的。

sentences.english: He also suggested another viewpoint on the formation of pre-historic ancient city ruins.
sentences.chinese: 他还对史前城址的形制演变提出了看法。

definition: old site/site of sth (palace, ancient state etc) that no longer exists
to dig up/to appear in an excavation/unearthed/to come up out of the ground
Erlitou (Xia dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 chao2] archaeological site at Yanshi 偃師|偃师[Yan3 shi1] in Luoyang 洛陽|洛阳[Luo4 yang2], Henan)
Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
